intro: Psoralidium micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered psoralidium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant produces small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged opposite each other on the stem. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as savannas and rocky areas. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique floral structure and potential medicinal properties.
